text: [Music]
my name is Sarah Marie du plessis and
I'm a senior software development
engineer on the Easter placement team in
Cape Town South Africa our job is is we
go to a lot of foundational services
that forms part of the ECT control plan
and we scrape data from within them and
We Gather it and we optimize it to build
a very very large data Lake to to
liberate data and and make it available
for people like a data scientists
research scientists and Engineers to to
ask qualitative questions and get
insight into the trends of how platform
behaves now what makes it challenging is
that we have literally petabytes of data
and the scale that literally the volume
that we need to provision water for
people is is incomprehensible
what's really exciting about my role is
having seen what people were able to do
when Starlight became available to me
what Insight became normal to people and
how fast the business were able to go
answer questions that they just weren't
able to before the Insight that they're
they're able to get by inspecting the
real world through my platform is really
really exciting easy to scan such a long
way when I joined um
I had Engineers come up to me male
Engineers come up to me and go
I want to to be a better male colleague
to female Engineers I want us to hire
more female Engineers I don't know how
else I can help what can I do
and what's been incredible
um over the last seven years has been to
see that those conversations don't
happen anymore I don't have those
conversations with any colleagues
anymore and what I think has changed it
is that as we've grown we've just
naturally hired more women who's been
really successful
so not only have we had women promote
into very senior roles with success and
on on merits but we have also hired a
newer generation of younger female
Engineers who's also started getting
promoted and coming up through the ranks
and that's normalized women doing this
job
